snippet: Shinzo Abe, the prime minister of Japan, appears to have slowed efforts to expand the role of the military after polls showed a significant drop in his administration’s approval rating.
abstract: Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe appears to be slowing efforts to expand role of military after polls show significant drop in his administration's approval rating.

byline.original: By MAKIKO INOUE and NEIL GOUGH
byline.contributor: Makiko Inoue reported from Tokyo, and Neil Gough from New York. Hiroko Tabuchi contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Shinzo Abe, the prime minister of Japan, appears to have slowed efforts to expand the role of the military after polls showed a significant drop in his administration’s approval rating.

headline.main: Polls Slow Japan’s Plan to Revise Constitution
headline.print_headline: Poll Slows Japan’s Plan to Revise Constitution
